notes.text:
A security update is now available for Red Hat Single Sign-On 7.3 from the Customer Portal.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Important. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Red Hat Single Sign-On 7.3 is a standalone server, based on the Keycloak project, that provides authentication and standards-based single sign-on capabilities for web and mobile applications.

This asynchronous patch is a security update for the Undertow package in Red Hat Single Sign-On 7.3.8. 

Security Fix(es):

* infinispan: invokeAccessibly method from ReflectionUtil class allows to invoke private methods (CVE-2019-10174)

* mojarra: Path traversal in ResourceManager.java:getLocalePrefix() via the loc parameter (CVE-2018-14371)

* Mojarra: Path traversal via either the loc parameter or the con parameter, incomplete fix of CVE-2018-14371 (CVE-2020-6950)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
notes.title: Details

publisher.issuing_authority: Red Hat Product Security is responsible for vulnerability handling across all Red Hat offerings.
publisher.name: Red Hat Product Security

document.title: Red Hat Security Advisory: Red Hat Single Sign-On 7.3.8 security update

cwe.name: Improper Limitation of a Pathname to a Restricted Directory ('Path Traversal')

notes.text: The getLocalePrefix function in ResourceManager.java in Eclipse Mojarra before 2.3.7 is affected by Directory Traversal via the loc parameter. A remote attacker can download configuration files or Java bytecodes from applications.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: CVE-2018-14371 mojarra: Path traversal in ResourceManager.java:getLocalePrefix() via the loc parameter
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
Before applying the update, back up your existing installation, including all applications, configuration files, databases and database settings, and so on.

The References section of this erratum contains a download link (you must log in to download the update).
There is no currently known mitigation for this flaw.

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2018-14371 mojarra: Path traversal in ResourceManager.java:getLocalePrefix() via the loc parameter

cwe.name: Use of Externally-Controlled Input to Select Classes or Code ('Unsafe Reflection')

notes.text: A vulnerability was found in Infinispan such that the invokeAccessibly method from the public class ReflectionUtil allows any application class to invoke private methods in any class with Infinispan's privileges. The attacker can use reflection to introduce new, malicious behavior into the application.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: invokeAccessibly method from ReflectionUtil class allows to invoke private methods
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: Red Hat OpenStack Platform's OpenDaylight contains the vulnerable library. This library is a requirement of other dependencies (Karaf and Hibernate). Under supported deployments, the vulnerable functionality is not utilized. Based on this, no OpenDaylight versions will not be fixed.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

There is no known mitigation for this issue.

vulnerabilities.title: invokeAccessibly method from ReflectionUtil class allows to invoke private methods

cwe.name: Improper Limitation of a Pathname to a Restricted Directory ('Path Traversal')

notes.text: A flaw was found in Eclipse Mojarra before version 2.3.14, where it is vulnerable to a path traversal flaw via the loc parameter or the con parameter. An attacker could exploit this flaw to read arbitrary files.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Path traversal via either the loc parameter or the con parameter, incomplete fix of CVE-2018-14371
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability
